meanings.definition: An estate held in absolute ownership, without recognizing any superior.
meanings.sent1: The allod belonged solely to the family for generations.
meanings.sent2: He inherited the allod from his grandparents.
meanings.sent3: The allod was so valuable that even the birds wanted to live there.
meanings.sent4: Her allod was a kingdom of its own, untouched by outside influence.
meanings.sent5: The allod stood proudly, a symbol of independence and heritage.

meanings.definition: A piece of land held in absolute ownership.
meanings.sent1: The allod stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent2: Farmers cherished their allod and worked the land with care.
meanings.sent3: The allod was so fertile that even the rocks seemed to bloom.
meanings.sent4: In the valley, her allod was a patchwork quilt of colors.
meanings.sent5: The allod whispered stories of the past to those who listened.
